byline.original: By CARL HULSE and JASON HOROWITZ

abstract: Some friends and associates of Vice Pres Joseph R Biden are concerned he will decide to run for president, imperiling Pres Obama's legacy by hurting Hillary Rodham Clinton's candidacy and resulting in Democrats losing 2016 election; many of Biden's political allies seem hesitant to relate their concerns to him out of respect for difficulty of decision that is ultimately extremely personal.
lead_paragraph: Few seem eager to tell the vice president of their reservations concerning a possible run for the presidency, regarded as a deeply personal decision.

headline.main: Friends of Joe Biden Worry a Run for President Could Bruise His Legacy
headline.print_headline: Biden Friends Worry Run Could Bruise Legacy

snippet: Few seem eager to tell the vice president of their reservations concerning a possible run for the presidency, regarded as a deeply personal decision.
